title: x/blog/content: io2014.article:18 bad code argument "_"
body:
by **bayualdiyansyah**: 
What does 'go version' print?
go version go1.3.3 linux/386

What happened?
go.blog can't running locally

What should have happened instead?
go.blog should running locally

---
Today i'm running Go Docs locally on port 9120 via `godoc -http=:9120`. When accessing
/blog , server print out text like this:

```
Blog content not available locally. To install, run 
	go get code.google.com/p/go.blog
```

so i give it a try. but, when i'am accesing /blog server shutdown and show me error like
this

```
2014/10/13 01:20:44
/home/[my-username]/go/src/code.google.com/p/go.blog/content/io2014.article:18 bad code
argument "_"

```
